Fusing the holy and the erotic, as befits her reputed history, Magdalene starred for many centuries in legend, drama, devotional tracts, and above all, visual art that celebrated her washing Jesus' feet, weeping at the foot of the cross, encountering the risen Lord and meditating on her past.

Slaughter, who died aged 88, was the first and only woman to lead the powerful House Rules Committee and the oldest sitting member of Congress. The daughter of a blacksmith in a Kentucky coalmine, Slaughter traced her lineage to the American explorer Daniel Boone and attacked her political opponents with a marksman’s accuracy and, not infrequently, a disarming grin.

In a 16-month examination of Interior's ability to detect and respond to cyber-threats, evaluators from the department's Office of Inspector General (OIG) also discovered that Interior's technicians simply did not implement a sweeping array of mandatory, government-wide defensive measures ordered up after the disastrous OPM hack, didn't investigate blocked intrusion attempts, and left “multiple” compromised computers on their network “for months at a time,” according to a redacted OIG report issued in March.

context_meta.title: Shares in cyber security group Sophos leap after beating forecasts
context_meta.summary: Shares in Sophos leapt on Thursday as the cyber security company said growth had accelerated in the last three months, reassuring investors following heavy share price falls in recent months. Sophos said that billings - an indicator of future revenues - had grown by 23pc in the three months to the end of March, the final quarter of its fiscal year. It was seen as a reassuring announcement, just three months after the company had revealed a sharp slowdown in growth. During the previous quarter, billings growth had declined sharply from 29pc to 18.7pc, spooking investors.  Analysts said the release of new products was likely to have boosted revenues. They include one used to guard against malicious software that can hijack computers to mine cryptocurrency, a trend that has intensified in recent months. Sophos, which sells antivirus and other cyber defence tools to businesses, has been one of UK's stand-out technology stocks of the last year, boosted by growing corporate fears about cyber attacks launched by criminals and rogue states. sophos shares six months The "WannaCry" global ransomware outbreak that crippled parts of the NHS as well as hundreds of businesses last year was seen as a particularly-crucial driver of growth last year. However, the company's shares have fallen by more than a third since their peak in January as growth appeared to slow down. Private equity group Apax, its biggest shareholder, sold almost half its stake in November.  Apax took Sophos public in 2015 in what was the biggest flotation of a software company in the UK, and a rare example of a technology group choosing London, rather than Wall Street, as a destination. Its value has doubled since then, despite the recent share price declines. On Thursday Sophos said that improved trading meant it was likely to report full-year billings at the top end of previous forecasts when it delivers full-year results next month. The news sent shares up as much as 20pc, before falling back slightly to trade 15.2pc up. Technology intelligence - newsletter promo - EOA However, several analysts warned that the company faces a tough few months maintaining growth, after the boom in business that followed the WannaCry attack in May.

Yet, with nearly $4 billion invested in blockchain research and development, not a single company has been able to demonstrate the successful integration of blockchain technology with IoT. In order to integrate with IoT, blockchain developers must treat each device as a unique user of the blockchain; as such, every piece of data transmitted from the IoT device is processed by the blockchain network as a transaction.

context_meta.title: California fights wildfires aggressively — but prevention takes a back seat
context_meta.summary: Dave Kinateder has a keen eye for trees. “It's a ticking time bomb,” he said, gazing across the dense, green carpet of trees near Quincy, a small community high in the northern Sierra Nevada. Last year's wildfires, the worst in modern California history, have put a microscope on the forests that cover a third of the state–in particular, on managing these wooded lands in ways that would reduce the frequency and intensity of such blazes. California is grappling with the counterintuitive dilemma of too many trees, packed too closely together, robbed of the space they need to thrive—and with how to clear out more than 100 million dead trees, felled by drought or insects, that provide tinder for the next infernos.

context_meta.title: Cause of Darien brush fires along Frontage Road undetermined
context_meta.summary: The cause of four small brush fires Sunday along Frontage Road near Lemont Road in Darien has not been determined. The Darien Police Department asked via Twitter on Sunday for anyone who has information about what may have started the fires to contact the Police Department or the fire protection district. A passer-by reported the fires at about 1:55 p.m. April 1, Leno said. There were four separate brush fires on the north side of North Frontage Road just east of Lemont Road, Leno said. context_meta.title: Pacific Northwest firefighters expect another busy season
context_meta.summary: YAKIMA — Wildland firefighters expect the Pacific Northwest will see another busy fire season this year with land around Yakima especially vulnerable. “If I were to pick one place that might experience above-average fire danger, it's the Yakima Valley and the eastern slopes” of the Cascade Mountains, said Josh Clark, a meteorologist with the state Department of Natural Resources. Less rain in the winter, above-average temperatures and less mountain snow mean fires could start earlier and burn longer than a typical season, Clark said. context_meta.summary: The wildfire danger is currently either moderate or high in every Tampa Bay area county. context_meta.title: I-95 near New Smyrna Beach reopens after brush fire
context_meta.summary: Both directions of I-95 near New Smyrna Beach reopened Thursday morning after a brush fire had them closed since Wednesday, the Florida Highway Patrol said. The interstate was shut down between State Road 44 and Dunlawton until about 9:30 a.m., troopers said. Troopers said drivers still need to use caution, as there is some lingering smoke. Troopers said they will continue to monitor I-95 throughout the day. idantonio@orlandosentinel.com or 407-420-5700

context_meta.title: Brush fire closes portion of Alligator Alley in Florida
context_meta.summary: A portion of Interstate 75 known as Alligator Alley is closed due to heavy smoke from a brush fire. Collier County Sheriff's officials said in a Facebook posting that the interstate is closed from the toll booth in Collier County on Florida's Gulf Coast to the toll booth in Broward County. The interstate is the major east-west highway that crosses the state on its southern end. Officials suggest State Road 80 to U.S. 27 as an alternative route for motorists trying to head east. Firefighters have been battling brush fires in southwest Florida since last week.

context_meta.title: Portugal volunteers replant trees burnt in devastating wildfire
context_meta.summary: Volunteers in central Portugal planted 67,500 trees on Sunday in the Leiria pine forest as the country recovers from the most devastating forest fires in its history. Leiria's trees were used to build ships that sailed in the 15th and 16th century discoveries when Portugal was a leading maritime nation. Fires struck Portugal in June and October last year and killed 114 people.

context_meta.title: Crews On Attack As Fire Burns Close To Homes
context_meta.summary: LARKSPUR, Colo. (CBS4)– Fire crews rushed to put out a grass fire burning near homes in Douglas County on Friday afternoon. The fire was burning near homes on Spruce Mountain Road near Larkspur. Many of the homes were horse properties. The fire has burned about 170 acres and was about 85 percent contained at 2:30 p.m. Copter4 flew over the fire as it spread near homes. Two homes were evacuated and several others were placed on pre-evacuation status. The evacuation for the homes was lifted but the pre-evacuation remained in effect. context_meta.author: rocky.j.mountain
context_meta.title: Northern California utility says it will turn the lights off when fire risk spikes
context_meta.summary: PG&E has long resisted the idea of shutting off electrified power lines to prevent wildfires, saying the public safety risks of putting communities in the dark was too high. Stung by accusations that its power lines may have sparked last October's disastrous wine country fires, Pacific Gas and Electric Co. announced Thursday it will begin switching off the juice during periods of "extreme fire conditions." The plan is part of a multipronged initiative the utility announced to tamp down wildfire risks, including trimming trees and vegetation adjacent to transmission wires more aggressively. "We really view this as a last resort," said Pat Hogan, PG&E senior vice president of electric operations.

context_meta.title: U.S. Medicare sets outpatient rate for Yescarta reimbursement
context_meta.summary: Medicare, the U.S. government healthcare program for the elderly and disabled, will pay hospitals close to its standard mark-up rate for administering cell therapy Yescarta for cancer outpatients, who will have a co-payment of nearly $80,000, according to the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS). Additional Medicare reimbursement for inpatients has been requested by Yescarta maker Gilead Sciences Inc and Novartis AG, which makes Kymriah, a similar therapy. Both therapies were approved last year by the Food and Drug Administration and are being used by growing number of major cancer centers.
